word: "OUR DEAR BROTHER WHITE THOUGHT WE WERE HIS ENEMIES BECAUSE WE DID NOT SEE THINGS AS HE DID. I HAVE NEVER LAID UP ANYTHING AGAINST THAT MAN OF GOD, THAT NOBLE PIONEER WHO LABORED SO HARD FOR THIS CAUSE. I ATTRIBUTED IT ALL TO DISEASE AND INFIRMITY."--G. I. BUTLER TO J. N. ANDREWS, MAY 25, 1883.
